# Click the “click here to go to Jupyter” link in the page
pyautogui.click(200, 145)

index_94 = (177, 315)
# Open the notebook to write and run our query
pyautogui.click(index_94)
time.sleep(1)

index_94 = (177, 315)
# Open the notebook by double‐clicking it
pyautogui.doubleClick(index_94)

index_132 = (1884, 1068)
# Open a new terminal session in JupyterLab so we can run SQL against database.db
pyautogui.click(index_132)

index_120 = (406, 188)
# Insert a new code cell below
pyautogui.click(index_120)

index_175 = (1149, 290)
# Focus the newly inserted blank code cell
pyautogui.click(index_175)

index_175 = (1149, 290)
# Click into the blank code cell so we can type our SQL query
pyautogui.click(index_175)
time.sleep(0.2)
# Write Python code to query the top‐10 actors by rental count
pyautogui.write(
"conn = sqlite3.connect('database.db')\n"
"df = pd.read_sql_query(\"\"\"\n"
"SELECT a.first_name || ' ' || a.last_name AS actor_name,\n"
"       COUNT(r.rental_id) AS times_rented\n"
"FROM actor a\n"
"JOIN film_actor fa ON a.actor_id = fa.actor_id\n"
"JOIN inventory i ON fa.film_id = i.film_id\n"
"JOIN rental r ON i.inventory_id = r.inventory_id\n"
"GROUP BY a.actor_id\n"
"ORDER BY times_rented DESC\n"
"LIMIT 10\n"
"\"\"\", conn)\n"
"df"
)

index_175 = (1149, 290)
# Complete the SQL query and close/run the cell
pyautogui.click(index_175)
time.sleep(0.2)
pyautogui.write(
"GROUP BY a.actor_id\n"
"ORDER BY times_rented DESC\n"
"LIMIT 10\n"
"\"\"\", conn)\n"
"df"
)
time.sleep(0.2)
# Run the cell
pyautogui.hotkey('shift', 'enter')

index_175 = (862, 289)
# Focus the erroneous cell and clear its contents
pyautogui.click(index_175)
time.sleep(0.2)
pyautogui.hotkey('ctrl', 'a')
pyautogui.press('backspace')

index_175 = (406, 290)
# Click into the cleared code cell and enter a properly terminated triple‐quoted query
pyautogui.click(index_175)
time.sleep(0.2)
pyautogui.write(
"conn = sqlite3.connect('database.db')\n"
"query = '''\n"
"SELECT a.first_name || ' ' || a.last_name AS actor_name,\n"
"       COUNT(r.rental_id) AS times_rented\n"
"FROM actor a\n"
"JOIN film_actor fa ON a.actor_id = fa.actor_id\n"
"JOIN inventory i ON fa.film_id = i.film_id\n"
"JOIN rental r ON i.inventory_id = r.inventory_id\n"
"GROUP BY a.actor_id\n"
"ORDER BY times_rented DESC\n"
"LIMIT 10\n"
"'''\n"
"df = pd.read_sql_query(query, conn)\n"
"df"
)
time.sleep(0.2)
# Run the cell
pyautogui.hotkey('shift', 'enter')

index_159 = (1149, 242)
# Click into the blank spot at the end of the SQL in the current code cell
pyautogui.click(index_159)
time.sleep(0.2)
# Finish the SQL, close the triple‐quote, read into dataframe and display
pyautogui.write(
" ON i.inventory_id = r.inventory_id\n"
"GROUP BY a.actor_id\n"
"ORDER BY times_rented DESC\n"
"LIMIT 10\n"
"'''\n"
"df = pd.read_sql_query(query, conn)\n"
"df"
)
time.sleep(0.2)
# Execute the cell
pyautogui.hotkey('shift', 'enter')

# Execute the SQL cell to load and display the result
pyautogui.hotkey('shift', 'enter')
